projects.title: RTR Engine
desc: The RTR Engine is a small scope render engine designed for learning different engine concepts. It represents the follow up project for Starman’s Roadtrip to Mars and gets continously expanded with new features.
I rebuilt the entire engine from the ground up, added new features such as GUI support, advanced error logging, a camera-path generator tool and new grahic effects such as bloom and shadow mapping.

projects.title: Molecular dynamics simulation
desc: The goal for this client server application was to effectively simulate molecular structures with constant frame rates over 60 FPS.
For this reason, I implemented a performance optimization technique called billboard impostor rendering, that reduces the number of vertices in the scene.

projects.title: Multi-sensoric vr controller
desc: Goal for this research project was to build an alternative controller for VR environments.

I built a controller prototype with Arduino sensor modules, such as ultrasonic, sound, gyroscope and accelerometer. Then I processed the sensor data in a C++ application which communicated to a Unity application.

projects.title: VR 360 Learning App
desc: During my bachelor thesis, I investigated the possibilities of VR 360 for learning and training environments.
Therefore, i developed a google cardboard application in Unity. Gaze interaction was used for answering questions during these videos.

projects.title: Starman's roadtrip to mars
desc: Starman’s Roadtrip To Mars is a fully functional game written in C++ and OpenGL. The idea is dedicated to Elon Musk’s Falcon Heavy Launch which contained a tesla model s with a dummy that should reach mars.
Despite being a game, we set the focus on the game engine development itself. I implemented several effects such as particle systems, HDR, cell shading as well as native PhysX implementation.

projects.title: VR puzzle game
desc: The goal for this research project was finding efficient ways to extend the game space environment.

We successfully developed a multiplayer capable prototype of a VR puzzle game within 2 months. Extending the game space environment was realized by using a platform that helped reducing motion sickness.

projects.title: Ticketline
desc: Ticketline represents an an entire ticket sales app for cinemas, theatres and other event based institutions.

In this project I led a team of 6 developers and worked as full-stack developer. We successfully delivered the application within 4 months. Although not being XR related, the project was extremely valuable for learning important tools and techniques in software engineering.

projects.title: Plumper Game
desc: In this project me and 4 other developers successfully implemented a matlab prototype for recognizing hand drawn pipes. The application automatically rotates the pipes in order to create a continous path from point A to point B.
Therefore, i applied different computer vision techniques, such as binarization, connected component labeling and bounding boxes.
